repnme.cdata!:
Armenia - Laying the foundations for
            sustainable development

abstracts.cdata!:
Armenia's economy has undergone a
            profound transformation since independence in the early
            1990s. Today, it is market oriented and highly receptive to
            trade, capital, and technological innovation. From the late
            1990s to 2008, gross domestic product (GDP) expanded by
            double digits on average, and Armenia now ranks as a lower
            middle-income country. As a result of sustained growth,
            ambitious reforms, and external inflows of capital and
            remittances, poverty plunged from over 55 percent at the
            start of the transition to less than 36 percent in 2010.

docna.cdata!:
Armenia - Laying the foundations for
            sustainable development

display_title.display_title:
Armenia - Laying the foundations
            for sustainable development

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Urban Heating Project
            for Armenia were as follows: outcomes were satisfactory;
            risk to development outcome was moderate; Bank performance
            was satisfactory; and borrower performance was also
            satisfactory. Some lessons learned includes: creation of
            enabling environment for effective and safe provision of
            heating services is important for ensuring sustainability of
            project achievements. Well targeted, demand-driven
            output-based capital subsidies can be effective but timely
            implementation of such a scheme requires early preparatory
            work and flexibility of procurement. Implementation of
            credit lines is successful when the funds are allocated
            transparently, financing terms are commercially determined
            and there is competition among the Participating Financial
            Institutions (PFIs). The on-lending funds were not earmarked
            for PFIs, which resulted healthy competition among financial
            institutions. Further, the PFIs had freedom to determine the
            lending terms for the sub-loans while assuming full credit
            risk, which helped the PFIs to develop their own due
            diligence skills required for provision of heating
            sub-loans. Energy efficiency measures coupled with
            rehabilitation of heating systems substantially increase the
            sustainability of heating investments. The schools, where
            basic energy efficiency measures were implemented in
            addition to rehabilitation of the heating systems saw
            significant decrease of their energy bills. This contributes
            to sustainability of safe and clean heating given rising
            natural gas prices. Collective heating solutions may be hard
            to implement even if those are the least-cost option. The
            ability of communities for self-mobilization when dealing
            with heat service providers is overestimated. Consumers
            often assign higher value to their autonomy and ability to
            make decisions independently and, thus, prefer individual
            heating solutions even if those are more expensive than
            collective heating option. This is particularly noticeable
            in communities with mixed income levels, where service
            standard expectations are different.

repnme.cdata!:
Energy reforms in Armenia - On the way to
            energy security

abstracts.cdata!:
This Results Profile talks about energy
            reforms in Armenia. The development of renewable energy in
            Armenia was of triple importance. Firstly, it used local
            energy sources, secondly it used renewable energy sources
            and thirdly, it used clean sources of energy. Armenia
            Renewable Energy Project designed the scheme for small
            hydropower stations, and developed model business plans and
            guidelines for the renewable energy sector. Ninety Two
            hydropower stations were constructed under the project which
            would meet six percent of the internal demand for
            electricity. Besides providing electricity, small hydropower
            stations also provided jobs.

docna.cdata!:
Energy reforms in Armenia - On the way to
            energy security

display_title.display_title:
Energy reforms in Armenia - On
            the way to energy security

repnme.cdata!:
Promoting safe and clean heating and
            increasing renewable energy generation in Armenia

abstracts.cdata!:
This Results Profile talks about
            promoting safe and clean heating, and increasing renewable
            energy generation in Armenia. Around 36 percent of residents
            of multi-apartment buildings relied on wood, household waste
            and other polluting fuels for heating, which were
            detrimental for health and the environment. The modern
            heater and gas connection costs were prohibitively high. Due
            to the lack of appropriate heating, many schools did not
            function during the winter months. World Bank supported
            Armenia by funding Urban Energy Project which focused on the
            use of safe, clean and affordable heating, and renewable
            energy generation. The World Bank energy program supported
            the government in improving the power transmission network
            infrastructure and reducing power supply gap.

Promoting safe and clean heating and

13957858.majtheme: Financial and private sector development,Environment and natural resource management,Urban development,Social protection and risk management

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Urban Heating
            Project for Armenia is to increase the use of clean,
            efficient, safe and affordable heating technologies in urban
            schools and multi-apartment buildings. The closing date will
            be extended from December 31, 2010 until June 1, 2011. The
            implementation of all of the project components is
            essentially completed. The project has successfully met all
            the outcome targets. There are savings under the
            'school heating' component of the project. The
            extension is necessary to utilize the savings under the
            'school heating' component and rehabilitate the
            heating systems of two additional schools. This will be the
            second extension of the project closing date, which will
            result in a cumulative extension of eleven months from the
            project's original closing date.

display_title.display_title:
Armenia - Urban Heating Project :
            restructuring : Main report

12865295.majtheme: Financial and private sector development,Environment and natural resource management,Urban development,Social protection and risk management

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Urban Heating
            Project for Armenia is to support the Borrower to increase
            the use of clean, efficient, safe and affordable heating
            technologies in urban schools and multi-apartment buildings.
            The changes are related to: (i) reallocation of credit
            proceeds from 'goods and works for others' and
            'grants' categories both financing capital grants
            to the urban poor for gas and heating services to the
            'goods and works for school heating systems'
            category financing rehabilitation of the heating system of
            urban schools; (ii) extension of the project closing date by
            six months to allow rehabilitation of the heating system of
            additional schools; and (iii) increase of the disbursement
            percentage for 'goods and works' category of
            expenses from 80 percent to 90 percent so as to maintain the
            co-financing requirement by the Government of Armenia on the
            same level as before the reallocation.

display_title.display_title:
Armenia - Urban Heating Project :
